answers.answer: I have high blood pressure.  It started at the end of my first child when I developed toxemia.  I since then have taken bp meds.  When I got pregnant with my next 2 which where girls at first I went of meds because my bp drop to normal. Then during the last trimester it went up and I was put on aldoment for my 2nd baby prescribed by my family Dr.  This medicine is ok but will make you feel really tired and worn down.  With may second daughter I believe they put me on atenolol.  I was also put on a baby apsirin once a day.  Dr said it was to help with pre-eclampsia that it wouldn't prevent it but it would help not to make it so severe.  I was watched closely with my pregnancies.  At about 28 and 30 weeks I had a Dr appt then starting at 32 weeks I went in every week.  Dr did a NST and ultra sound. Which turned out to be a good then with my 2 daughter in one week I went from have 12 c of anmontic fluid to only 2.  I went straight to the hospital to have her.  With hbp your placenta gets old quicker.  With both my daughters I went up until 3 days before due date.   With my last baby it got bad really bad.  My Dr always had me check my bp at home at first about once a day then up to about 3 or 4 times.  Well around my 26 weeks I told her that at home my bp was up around 169/92 and sometimes it got up to 176/110.  But in the office when the medical assistance took my bp it was always 130/70.  My Dr. didn't recheck my bp.  I now wish that I insisted her to due so.  Finally at 31 weeks my Dr had to be at the hospital so the Nurse Pactioner handle my visit.  She came in after the MA did her thing and again my bp when she took it was 130/70, the first thing she noticed was my shoes and she ask is that a new look (my shoes were untied) I said no I cant tie my shoes my feet are so swollen.  She took my bp it was 200/110.  I went to the hospital.  Over the next several I was sent back and forth to the hospital.  Until finally they keep me.  Long story shorten.  4 days after being admitted I gave birth and I was on a vent and so was my baby.  I had developed super imposed Preeclampsia,(my 24 hour urine was 1900 gms this was done twice in the hospital and once a week before they wanted to confirm the results) this was also causing my kidneys fail) pulmonary edema, Hellp syndrome, and Congestive Heart Failure. I don't tell you this to scare you but to share with you that it didn't have to get so bad for me only if my Bp had been controlled and if I had gotten the proper treatment earlier.  I beat myself up a lot because I didn't make my Dr check my Bp.  I knew the MA wasn't taking my bp correctly(there was one time I ask her what my bp was right after she had finished because before I came inside I took my bp in my car and I had like 158/92 she walked over to my chart and looked at it and said oh it is the same as it was last week) and when my Dr didn't due anything when I mentioned it I should have seek a different Dr.  It is never to late to change Dr's when pregnant.  OH Yeah ever since the time the NP took my bp just less then a 1/2 from the MA only a Nurse took my Bp when ever I went back for follow-ups after I got out of the hospital.

I only had high blood pressure at the time of delivery last pregnancy and had to be given an IV to stablize it.  I have 3 friends who were able to stablize their blood pressure through pregnancy with their meds and had healthy deliveries.  It is very common.  You may also want to check with a nutritionist to help with eating the right foods to help with lowering your blood pressure.good luck!

I worked with my first girl until 3 weeks before due date.  I worked in meical insurance.  With the last 2 I didn't work.  I do believe stress played a big roll in how sick I got with my last.  I was dealing with a SIL whom I believe was very inapporiate with my daughters without any family support.  She would tell them they didn't have to listen to me and that they could do things as long as they don't tell me.  They were 3 and 5 at the time.  She told me that she would take them whenever she wanted and without her husband my husbands brother.  Plus the stress of loss of income.  Try to keep your stress low.  Your Dr may want you to go on maternity leave early.I think I got so sick with my last baby because my bp went so long unchecked.  I was in the hospital 4 days before having my son on the vent for 4 days in the CCU for 5 days then stayed an additional week in recovery.  I am just now feeling like I am as strong as before this pregnancy.  I too was on that Mag stuff.  It was awful.  I was also on atenolol and procardia.  My Dr says that is the choice nowdays that it is often used to prevent labor for those that go into labor early.  My baby was in the NICU for 5 weeks 6 days. He was 3lbs 14 ozs He had to recussated at birth, was septic, Dx with respirtary distress syndrome, he was jaundice, has reflux other little minor things but is really due well.Sounds like you are under good care and on top of things-you'll and your baby will be fine.  My friend just had twins at 31 weeks and they are doing great.  They were 4.6 and 4. 9 and only was in the NICU for 4 weeks.

when i was pg w/ds i started taking aldomet about 9 or 10 weeks into the preg. i was not currently taking bp meds but hbp has always run in my family so i was not shocked. my dr started me out on very low dosage. as the preg progressed my meds had to be increased several times to maintain a normal bp. during this time i also worked a very stressful job. at the end of my 6th month or beginning of 7th month i was taken off work and the meds were increased at that time. after a week i had lost 14lbs., had very little swelling and my bp had dropped considerably so we were able to lower my daily dosage. at the end i think i was taking about 250mg. i realized i had to slow down, after i made myself realize this everything went pretty well. i was always so concerned about side effects on my baby but, he was completely healthy and has had no major medical problems. just do what you can to keep your bp low, take it easy and everything s/b just fine.

My daughter had kawasaki's disease when she was 21 months old. She had the highest Sedimentation rate (the only way to check to make sure damage wasn't being done to heart, blood vessels, etc.) her doctors had ever seen with no obvious damage (i.e. aneurisms, etc.) In 1983, the hospital treated over 60 cases of kawasaki's disease - they called it an epedemic.She is now pregnant and her due date is 9/24/08. She had her weekly checkup yesterday and her doctor confirmed that the baby is the same size it was 3 weeks ago. Although she normally has very , very low blood pressure (low 60's over upper 70s, her blood pressure has risen considerably and she is puffing up in her hands, feet and lips. A friend who works for another OB said my daughter should be induced because even though her high blood pressure (130/87) does not put her in the stroke zone, it is stunting the baby's growth and poses potential problems for toxemia for my daughter. My daughter's doctor is very conservative, which I normally like, but I'm not sure is she's remembering that my daughter also had kawasaki's disease as an infant either.Does anyone know if there are any long-term problems associated with infantile Kawasaki's Disease and high blood pressure during pregnancy?Thanks for whatever information you can provide.

question: I'm 43 and pregnant, around 9-10 weeks. I have high blood pressure that I developed with my last pregnancy almost 2 yrs ago. My blood pressure was normal until around 7-8 month and then went high. I was put on bed rest, then hospitalization till the baby was born at 34 weeks. I was given blood pressure meds. also. When I found out I was pregnant this time.I was taking Diovan, they took me off that and now on aldomet. Blood pressure is ok while on the med. worried that later on it will climb higher, just hope it will behave till the baby can be born healthy. Anyway, anyone have/had this experience. What can I expect?
title: Anyone else have high blood pressure and are pregnant?
